Horn''' (born August 29, 1966 in [[Foreman, Arkansas]]{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc|page=193|year=2008|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}}) is an American [[country music]] singer. Horn recorded an album for [[Curb Records|Curb]]/[[Universal Records|Universal]] in 1997 produced by Wynn Jackson and Steve Keller.{{cite news|last=Flippo|first=Chet|title=Country Dance Club Industry Finds Healthy Balance; Tubb Shop Turns 50|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=IQ8EAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA28|accessdate=April 11, 2015|newspaper=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=May 3, 1997}} A dance mix of the song "If My Heart Had an Ass (I'd Kick It)" was released to clubs to introduce him. Horn's first radio single, "If Dreams Have Wings", was released on October 29, 1996.{{cite web|title=If Dreams Have Wings – James T. Horn|url={{AllMusic|class=album|id=mw0000416904|pure_url=yes}}|publisher=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=April 11, 2015}} Deborah Evans Price of ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' gave the song a favorable review, writing that "Horn has a very traditional voice, and his catch-in-the-throat delivery perfectly suits the heartfelt lyric."{{cite news|last=Price|first=Deborah Evans|title=Reviews & Previews|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=vwkEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA86|accessdate=April 11, 2015|newspaper=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=September 28, 1996}} His second single, "Geronimo", was released on September 23, 1997.{{cite web|title=Geronimo – James T. Horn|url={{AllMusic|class=album|id=mw0000416902|pure_url=yes}}|publisher=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=April 11, 2015}} A music video for the song was directed by Steven R. Monroe and aired on [[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]].{{cite news|title=Production Notes|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=rg0EAAAAMBAJ&pg=RA1-PA76&dq=%22james+t.+horn%22+%22Geronimo%22|accessdate=April 11, 2015|newspaper=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=January 17, 1998}} Its B-side, "Texas Diary", peaked at number 72 on the ''Billboard'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart.
